reviews.review_msg: The class is great if you want a real introduction to physical geography. I thought I was prepared for the lab exam, but it was harder than it seemed, dont skip studying for it. The prof is really passionate about the topics in the course so the lectures aren't too bad to sit through. Grading was fair and evenly weighted

Tara is a great professor and GEOG 111 is a smart choice for non-science students looking for a relatively easy B-SCI course. As long as you review lecture slides before tests and complete all the labs you will do well! Tara makes boring geography stuff as interesting as possible and is very reasonable in terms of quizzes/scheduling.

Tara's class organization was seamless, making the course navigation easy, especially during the strike this semester. Her lectures were information-heavy, but her slides were great. Sometimes quizzes focused only on 1 out of the many learning objectives. However, an amazing prof, definitely take class with her again! She's super cool and caring.

I found this class to be so so difficult. The TA I had did a very bad job at running my lab and explaining lab concepts. The labs and lectures are quite unrelated. The case study quizzes are so difficult and not entirely based on the learning objectives we are told to use as a study guide. Lab exam was so hard, I believe I failed. Not very happy.

Highly recommend this prof!!! Makes 2 hour lectures feel shorter because they are engaging and interesting, very clear syllabus and slides, labs relate to course content, and bonus no midterm or final for lecture content. Chiefs kiss

Tara is a good prof. The course itself was interesting but content was dry at times - that's no fault of her own, sometimes things are just not as interesting. She was fair when it came to criteria for exams and the engaging part of lectures help you study. The labs are quite tedious, but doable. However, the lab exam is difficult so study hard

I love the lectures, both structure and content. I really appreciated how interactive the lectures were as well as the opportunity to have a break in the middle. The difficulty was moderate, challenging but not impossible.


Professor was very approachable and encouraged questions.
I plan to purposefully look for courses by this proffesor.

Tara is clearly interested in what she's talking about, and it definitely transfers over to her lectures, which are always engaging and informative, without being too content-dense. She has a very good knack for explaining difficult concepts. GEOG111 has been the highlight of my week all semester, would definitely take it again!
